title: Charities and the Commons: The Pittsburgh Survey, Part I. The People

quoteFirst: The Capitol, splendidly situated on a hill ninety feet above the level of the Potomac, dominates the entire city with its soaring dome and ranks among the most beautiful buildings in the world. It stands in a park of about fifty acres, is seven hundred and fifty-one feet in length and one hundred and
quoteLast: hundred and twenty-four feet wide, and consists of a main edifice of sandstone, painted white, and of two wings of white marble. The building covers an area of three and one-half acres.
title: The Circle of Knowledge: A Classified, Simplified, Visualized Book of Answers
author: Ruoff, Henry W. (Henry Woldmar), 1865-1935 [Editor]
